text: I'll admit, at first, I wasn't too thrilled about the idea of coming here, but it turned out to be a lot better than I expected. I guess the word, "Buffet" never appealed to me, I guess. I was overwhelmed by all of the many different food choices, and I ended up having some pasta w/ Alfredo sauce and some fruit. The pasta was cooked just right, and the Alfredo sauce was bursting with flavor. The grapes were huge, and I found myself trying to eat more, although I was full. The only thing that I wasn't terribly thrilled with were the pastries. I don't know what they put in those things, but it sure ain't sugar. I'm not saying all of the desert was bad. I mean, the sugar free cherry pie was good. I liked the food, but I'm not sure if I liked it enough to go back there again.

Rampart Buffet at the Marriott isn't bad or great! But I know they r trying hard to maintain or bring more customers in from the Suncoast Casino next door! Also it is easy to get comp points for your buffet deals.

Rampart buffet isn't very good the salad bar is very meager and the food not too good except for the Chinese section which was excellent and all toghether I would give it a c+  the Italian food was also good

Awful awful awful! 
The descriptions written on the glass were not accurate and did not describe the items. Each meat item was lukewarm, and the fat congealed. They served large beef ribs, which were again lukewarm, and also over salted and tough as they had been outside for a while. I mostly ate the ice cream and drank soda.

Thursday night NY deli buffet!!  For 18.99 (16.99 with a players card) I'm more than willing to drive off the strip to this place!!  Even better, if you play 20 slot points and ask at the counter, they'll give you 2 for 1!!!  Highlights are were corned beef, knish, Greek salad, and everything at the dessert station!

Better than it was 6 months ago, but you do need to watch out for the chinese entrees being a bit old and dry. They definitely need to prepare smaller portions given the lack of demand or mix it up on a daily basis. Darn good burger and bun for lunch, I swear they must use authentic sauerkraut for the hot dogs, my digestion definitely kicked it up a notch after munching on some. Prime rib was good, pork loin as well, pizza was overdone and flat. Excellent pastries and ice cream options, freshly cut pineapple as well. The greek salad on the other hand took a bit of a nose dive since the last visit, tasteless olives and wimpy cucumbers. Pepsi products being served a big minus, Champage brunch for $12,99 sat/sun a plus, given it includes the previously mentioned Prime Rib.

Yeah, you could probably recruit for the John Birch society with the crowd they get on any given day but pleasant enough regardless.
Don't waste your money or your time. This was the worst place I've been to in a while. The wait time was aweful, the food was disgusting & the service was terrible. I won't ever go back.

Came to the lunch buffet on Tuesday before 3:00pm.  The price is $5.00 for seniors with players card.  That includes drinks and all you can eat.  The food is mediocre, but you can't beat that price anywhere in the city.  Cheaper than McDonalds with more variety.  Very good desserts.  Loved the carrot cake and cheesecake.

Let me help you with 3 words - DON'T EAT HERE! My husband was here for a conference, we decided on the buffet because I was so hungry I figured I would be sure to find several things I would like here. I could not have been more wrong! I was so sad I could have cried! 
They open at 11am, we arrived around 12:30. I figured the food would be hot, fresh & in abundance. But it was NONE of the above! I wish I had gone around and taken pictures, but honestly, I was just way too upset to do so. My husband only had limited break time before having to get back to his conference so I forced myself to find something that could hold me over...I reasoned with myself - there are starving children in the world, at least this is "something",  it was only $10,  I can make it work for the moment.
The pictures in the album are so misleading!  On our visit, nothing was labeled(except some of the desserts) so you really had to guess at what everything was. Additionally, there were not a lot of food offerings and what was there was either dried out, over cooked (pastas), or old. The desserts were the only items that looked okay, but there weren't a lot and they don't make a meal. 
I tried to make it work. I've never eaten white rice that was hard, crunchy & sticky - I thought I was gonna break my teeth! One bite of the pizza was all I could do - it was doughy; the baked chicken wing had 2 feathers on it that we're longer than the wing tip - No exaggeration!!! I was done.
To be fair, there were three positives - the cheesecake was good - not great, but good was wonderful after everything else was so bad. The beef at the carving station, once it was restocked, was really good- very nicely seasoned.  The service was great! They were very friendly & attentiv

I gave this place another try on Wed for lunch much were changed the food was good better than usual. the place was clean the desert section was new and very organized and they had new deserts that were very good. The  food was fresh.I guess they have new chefs now.
 The price is very good too. I recommend this place. For a long time I was giving this place one star but now four star. Not there yet for five star.

Not good. I would call this buffet the Fresh From A Frozen Bag buffet. Everything was watered down and luke warm. I had a couple of ravioli and strands of spaghetti covered with marinara sauce. After stepping away from the buffet my plate was filled with water. I had to dump the water off in the trash can! The Chinese food was just ok. The meat available for carving did not look appetizing. The ONLY thing that was rockstar good was the apple crisp with a side of whiskey sauce. It is a do not miss. Lastly, watery chocolate ice cream came out of the vanilla side. My server was friendly and attentive. One star for the server and apple crisp. I just can't bring myself to give this buffet two stars especially at $23!!
Went due to 2 for 1 new customer deal, but was fairly good even if I would not put it on the top of my list of favorite places to go for a buffet

I am a long time regular at the rampart and have to say that the buffet management should hang their heads in shame.  Going fro left to right: in the Chinese section the beef chow fun had no beef, the egg rolls were really little spring rolls and the dumplings were really pot stickers.  moving on to the American section I tried the fried chicken and the crust was hard and leathery and the chicken meat was dry and had the consistency of rope.  In the salad section none of the dressings were labeled and when I asked a worker to identify them he did but with an attitude that suggested that I was stupid for not being able to identify without help.  In the Italian section there was shrimp scampi but no plain pasta to put it with and the tortellini was not identified as meat or cheese.  The clerk there didn't know.  The lemon meringue pie was OK.  The table service was very good.  Stations and Coast casinos have comparably priced buffets that are far superior in both variety and quality.

Four words:
I tossed me cookies.
Arrrrrr.
This place made me upchuck me dinner fro' yesterday night!
I would not go here even if I was dead and had nothing to lose

Went here last night because I got a flyer in the mail from them. It had a BOGO entry to the buffet & I noticed on Friday they had all you can eat crab legs. Even though the coupon wasn't valid for Fridays or Saturdays I still took the BF out to dinner because we loooove crab legs. I used to go to Hush Puppies on Monday nights because they offered all you can eat crab legs for $25 but they stopped that a couple years ago. 

We got there around 6 or so & even though the line was long we probably only waited about 30-45 minutes. Not bad IMO. 

With tax for two people it came out to about $47 & to me that's okay because we beasted on those crab legs. I probably got about 4 or 5 plates of it. Yum!

The BF got some other stuff. Prime rib (it looked pretty gross. Very dry looking) and he said it was pretty dry & tough, which didn't surprise me. Usually all meat like that from buffets are not very good. 

Also had some fried shrimp (tasted like corn dogs) & hush puppies (gross) but I did get some fried shrimp balls on skewers & those were actually really good. 

Their desserts were better than most buffets. The chocolate tart & key lime tart were good. The banana cream pie was excellent & it was sugar free which surprised me. And they also have a cool espresso machine. I got two chocolate espressos. Pretty good!

All in all we came here for the crab & crab alone & it was worth it. Probably will go back for Brazilian Steakhouse night. 

Oh & our server was pretty attentive. Much better than I've had in the past at other buffets. She was an older lady & very nice.

This was my first time in rampart buffet at the JW  Marriott.   It was the Friday seafood buffet with prime rib.   The total cost for 2 of us was a little bit more than  $40.  The line was long but we were able to meet some locals who actually invited us to sit with them because seating was limited.   Ok...the food selection was small.  Asian cuisine, Italian,  American, and a salad bar.  Dessert choices sucked.  Service was fair.   Let me focus on the food:  fried calamari-fair, crab legs ordinary,  prime rib was bland.  Other stuff I  had was uneventful.   So bottom line...just your ordinary Vegas buffet...minus the lounge show.

The 2 for 1 is not even worth the gas.
$17.00 for two people seams like a great deal. It wasn't nice people but horrible food.
We laughed at a review that said this is that bad well the food was that bad and I paid for it all night.

The only thing that keeps me coming back is that it is free.  My eye just caught Louisa M's review.  That's pretty much it, free is free, and I hate to cook.

If you would at least stir the food occassionaly it would look better.  My husband calls the soup water.  I have to do a gymnastics feat to reach the back row of the salad bar that leaves much to be desired anyway.  Other then Thurs night the menu seldom changes.  B O R I N G !!!!!!

I do like your coffee machine tho'!

We have been coming here the last few Fridays (due to no meat for lent!). I wouldn't say it's an upscale buffet compared to many on the strip, but it definitely gets the job done. It costs $21 per person... but it's easy to get comps from the casino if you gamble or even the 2 for 1 coupons!

FOR HER: I stick to two things when I'm here... The all-you-can-eat crab legs (the lines for the hot ones can be long, but I've found the heat shrinks the meat and the cold ones have more flavor!) and the lobster ravioli, which I top with alfredo sauce & parmesan. I'll also grab a salad from the salad bar and top it with crab meat!

FOR HIM: He gets a lot of the Asian chow fun noodles (contains chicken but he picks it out), the fried shrimps (with cocktail dipping sauce), salt & pepper calamari, and pizza (they have seafood pizza which is convenient for all those who are also avoiding eating meat for lent!).

after walking around the casino and looking around the hotel a bit...it was off to the buffet.
for the sake of total disclosure...we had a hook-up that got us free dinner at the buffet.
but im no stranger to the buffet
as far as buffets go...this joint is just ok.
no significant seafood, just some fish which didnt look very appetizing and "fish" as in fish n chips.  they did have manhattan clam chowder, that my friend says was decent...but i like new england style so i passed.  did have the chicken noodle soup instead.  should have passed.
they had rib eye which i tried...was ok.  nothing to write home about.  they had beef ribs as well...again just ok.  was kind of hit n miss.  some ribs were good others too dry.
they had a chinese section that was just ok. 
i sense a theme here........
the place was just ok.

Had lunch here, food was not great. Most of the selection was filler items. Food was kinda cold and the overall selection was small. The deserts were just a assortment of store bought pies u see at every low cost buffet. Price was high at 16$. The ice cream and sandwich bar was good.

Lunch buffet was terrible.  The General Tso's chicken tasted burnt, the pork was way overseasoned.  If someone gave me a ticket to go for free, I would struggle with that.  On the other hand, the deserts were the best I have had in Vegas.  I would only pay for the desert portion, not the meal.  They had cream puffs using real cream, a little lemon meringue tart that was excellent.  In the desert line...they deserve a 5 but the food itself was awful.
The quality of the food here was fair to good. Most of items were not interesting. Only a handful of dishes worthwhile to eat. Service was excellent however and that alone warrants 3 stars.

Came here Friday night for the crab legs and was not disappointed. Our server was spot on as well. We will definitely be back to try some of the other themed nights that have here. This buffet is way better than the garbage at the Suncoast

Avoid...unless its free.  Highlight of the buffet was the apple cobbler. Everything was cold or barely warm and lacking any kind of flavor.  Its funny, I read another review that said something about it feeling like a nursing home cafeteria, and it somewhat does. It wasn't the cleanest either. I went on a weekday evening and I think it was around $18 a person. Definitely not worth it.

I only eat here when I get comps. It's def not the type of place that I would pay to eat at.
The Chinese station is generally good. Crab night is miserable with the small amount of crab, THE PLASTIC TONGS THAT DONT GRAB, And the long long lines of people.
The mango mouse in the dessert bar is delicious.

Best buffet in town! definitely for a local casino. They have a huge selection and can seat a lot of people. Also if your having a big group you can call and let them know ahead of time and they block of a section for you. We had a party of 27 people and they made accommodations for us to have a section to our selves. The servers here are always on top of your drinks and clearing up the plates. I've been here on almost every night of the week and Friday is my favorite because of the sea food / prime rib buffet. They have snow crab legs that are pretty meaty and you can get them cold or steamed. We just went on Thursday which is NY deli night and they have pastrami, stuffed cabbage, italian sausage, kielbasa, sour kraut and a pretty good hand carved meat selection. They also had a big selection of Dr. brown's bottled sodas. Wednesdays is Brazilian Steak House night and  Saturday is steakhouse night. The desert station always has a wide variety of gourmet deserts. I believe they have the asian food selection and wood fire pizza every night. both delicious. I have only been here for dinner so i'm not sure about the breakfast or lunch buffets but i'm sure they are delicious!

If I'm going to a local casino buffet on the West side, I'll pick this one over Red Rock's Feast. No joke, even though the line is shorter but takes just as long because everyone moves in slow motion here, the food selection is smaller but I feel like the quality is higher.

Got here at 6PM on Thursday, the NY Deli theme night, and spent $20 for two using a BOGO coupon and the cardholder's discount. We were able to move to the register pretty quick, but after that it was a good 15 minutes til we were actually seated at a table.

Bonus stars for being able to order the old fashioned Dr. Brown's old fashioned sodas- BF inhaled the black cherry and the cream soda flavors!

NY Deli theme night includes options like lox and capers (though no bagels to put it on, which was odd given the amount of cream cheese they had nearby), pastrami and corned beef (surprisingly NOT good considering they were highlighted), matzo ball soup (better than expected!), cabbage rolls and laktkas. 
Other tasty options included the short ribs, Asian chicken wings and bbq ribs, Greek salad with tons of feta cheese, and fairly decent prime rib- considering their Friday special advertises it as a featured entrée, I didn't expect to see it on other nights.

Like I said, service was slow to get seated, but the food was better quality than I'm used to getting at a buffet- you won't have a mile of different food options, but here they do seem like the focus on doing less dishes to a higher standard rather than putting out a bunch of mediocre dishes just to have "variety".
Would come back for the Brazilian theme night, NY deli just isn't really my thing.
Not bad food but service  sucks our sever come to our table like 2 times!!   Wish they would pay attention to there section and their guests!!!
The worst I've ever had.  It has to be all comps for them to serve the kind of food they do. We have never gone to a specialty and never will. We've tried it twice and that was 2 times too many.

I see low reviews.  Did they improve it when I went last week?  I went for lunch on a Friday afternoon.  It was fantastic.  It seemed all the food was fresh, not frozen, especially the vegetables.  I also must note that finally a place has good egg rolls, nobody seems to get it right.  The sliced Beef brisket was great too, and I don't eat a whole lot of red meat.  Also Douwe Egberts is my favorite coffee, and they have a self serve.  I didn't even feel too out of place with all the older clientele, they seemed relaxed.  The Feast at Stations casinos are hit and miss with a lot of anxious hyper-overeaters, making for a fairly unpleasant experience at times comparatively.

The employees are very nice.  But the only plus for the buffet is the sugar free selection on the dessert section.  It just seemed like the food sat for a long period of time or was over cooked.  But you can get a voucher for a buy one get one buffet and the price was ok.

I have read some of these review with disbelief! My family has come to the Rampart buffet many times and every time their food was great! Last time we went was today, Sunday 10/13/2013 and had a great dinner! The prime rib was cooked perfectly. I cut off just a bite of mine and without saying anything, put it on my wife's plate as I do sometimes to get her to try something that I feel is extra special. She took the bite in and she stopped mid sentence to proclaim its' tenderness and flavor! I have never been able to shut my wife up before and actually begged me to go and get her a slice of her own!

The Asian food on the bar was also out standing. The egg rolls were crunchy and very good. The peel and eat shrimp was only slightly harder to peel than at other places, but still delicious. The breaded cod had a very light coat of breading and other than the skewered okra, was the only thing I saw that was deep fried in the "American" section (obviously the fried wontons and egg rolls were the things deep fried in the Asian foods section).

I did not sample anything in the Italian food area but everything all looked great.

The deserts were all gourmet.
Not what would one expect from the JW Marriott. The food was blah and not much selection.  Will never go to this place until they upgrade the quality

The food here is OK, nothing more. They have really gotten chintzy with discounts from Restaurant.com, too, as you get very little discount for your money. Deli night is a joke, as they charge full buffet price for cold lunchmeat that I could buy at the grocery store.

Went to eat there for "Brazilian Wednesday" and I was very disappointed. The only thing Brazilian was this gigantic piece of meat which did not look very appetizing. The ambience of the buffet is that of a hospital cafeteria, very depressing. The service was very good, but  for 45$ for 2 people you're much better going somewhere else.

Only have gone on Thursday nights for the NY Style Buffet and the whole family loves it!  Excellent selection and food is good.  Bummer they don't have better prices for kids and seniors on Thursday nights.

Well since i bashed it last night i had to give this one another try. Havent been to the Rampart buffet in years but my memory was pretty negative about this place. Recently the only reason ive gone is because the cafe was closed so the only option was the buffets breakfast section. 

This time my expectations were exceeded but not greatly. Food was ok but their presentation is very dismal, i guess i cant expect anything else from a buffet, but more rotations? and no empty platters would help a lot. The salad was empty, fruit was almost gone so i came back for dessert and luckily it was refilled.

Pretty much a decent standard overall. I've been to worse casino buffets and much better ones, but for the 12 dollar price this one is acceptable. If in the mood for prime rib, salmon and other randomly combined things this place works.

Most selection was probably with the desserts, but we were disappointed with no strawberries or bananas, 7pm and all that was available was boring marshmallows. 

Sidenote-- all you hear in the cafe is the slot machines, in the buffet all we heard was the irish pub across the hall, but that depends on time of day im sure

Very disappointed in this buffet. It has been going steadily downhill for some time now (I'm talking about lunch only). The Asian section is still okay if the right chef is cooking but the rest of the food items are rather bland and tasteless to me. I live in a senior community and they sent residents here a coupon for a 2 for 1 lunch or dinner but then when you show up at the cashier they charge you full price and not member's price. A real cheap outfit! I stopped going to their brunch long ago when they eliminated the prime rib. You can do better down the street.

Well worth the drive.  This off the strip hotel is truly for locals but always welcomes out of towners.  Give this buffet a try, you wont be disappointed. Excellent service and a variety of food - good to satisfy anyones palate.
Had a great time at this buffet, it was only 13 dollars the food was excellent and they gave all the champagne you can drink, you can't go wrong.

I've lived in Las Vegas ten years and have been to every buffet there is, red rock, Texas Station, fiesta, alianta, rio, Caesars, etc. Then one night me and my husband wanted to try something new ,somewhere we hadn't been,  so I suggested the Rampart casino buffet,  it happened to be a Saturday which is steak night all you can eat for $16.99 with your rewards card , which you can get there free, the best buffet hands down , prime rib and many other cuts of steak, and Friday night is all you can eat seafood for $19.99 , weds BBQ night , the first time i went was three months ago ive been going at leat 4 times a month especially on Saturday id highly recommend this place, plus the deserts creme brule, panacotti, cheesecake omg delicious if you haven't been here go I guarantee you will go back

I use to eat at this Buffet a few times a week for lunch.  It was a comfortable place with a friendly staff and you could always find something to eat.   Now with the new owners it has gone completely down hill.  Anything that was worthwhile is gone and has been replaced with the cheapest food.  Everything from the salad bar to the  inconsistent variety of vegetables is awful.  I would no longer recommend.

Ok so here is an honest review of rampart passover buffet.The potato pancakes were poor.They were flat.They should of been cripsy outside soft on inside.Chopped chicken liver was flat.No taste...salt.Potato knishes......flat .......not crispy.Chopped white fish salad .......a disgrace.Kiska......oh my God.....salty that is it.Brisket very good.Short ribs ......ok.prime ribs ok
A Jewish person needs to be in charge.

The host staff was horrible. We had to wait an hour, which is not terrible in of itself. However were a group of six and they sat over 25 people before they sat us. When we spoke to the hostess about how my mother was on O2 and had limited time, we were told she should have sat by herself. 
The wait staff was wonderful and the food was delicious. I bad they first people we  countered were rude and not well trained.
Dinner = very expensive, very limited offerings (Chinese, Italian, and American) as compared to other Las Vegas buffets

So, my review was met with one of their 2-3 scripted replies...I don't care how much you claim your food is prepared "fresh daily"...I had never before, nor since, seen gnats in a salad bar in Las Vegas. Step up your game, you're giving Marriott a bad name!

We were so hungry any food would have been okay but this was aweful. Like a hungry man meal would have been better. TV dinner type stuff. They are next to such a beautiful hotel, step it up! You can do it!!!

This is probably the worst buffet in Vegas I've had.  The food is always cold and drenched and soaked in cold sauce.  I have been there a few times, because of people that I know inviting me because they have free tickets, not by choice.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.  I feel so tired and ill leaving this buffet. I am never going back there again. Waste of time and nothing worth eating.

We ate here on December 27th, and the hostess was rude, kept telling everyone in line they were closing even though we had 20 minutes still left before 3pm and were close to the cashier, everyone in line told her that; especially since the majority of us were standing there for 20+ minutes, but she ignored us and kept harassing us say "none of you will be accepted" and shoving a buffet sign in the middle of the line to stop us from entering..... This is the most unprofessional and disgusting abuse of power I've seen from an employee, and the buffet supervisor was standing nearby and didn't say a word to this hostess..... management should be taught better how to close up for the next meal service as well as disciplining this psycho hostess (short older Asian lady) I wont be returning here, the food was not even worth it, barely a selection. You get a much better grade of service and food at Suncoast Casino next door.
Service was great food was delicious definitely a must come back anytime ! Compliments too the espresso machine very good.

I ended up getting a free buffet when I signed up for a players card here. There was a promo going on that night where you spin the wheel and my prize was a "buy one, get one free buffet." I was with some family members for this Vegas trip so it turned out to be an ok deal for dinner. The catch with this "buy one, get one free buffet" however is that the buffet you are buying is a full price buffet. This means you can't apply any other discount such as the player's card discount or a senior discount.

We came here on a Friday night and so a lot of the seafood fans were overjoyed. Friday nights they offer crab legs and even have the big gray buckets (a la Boiling Crab style) for folks to throw away their crab legs.

For non-seafood eaters like me, I felt the selection was a little limited. They did have steak, fried pork and fried chicken among the meat selections but it just seemed like they didn't have too much. I got a couple items from the Asian section such as their mapo tofu but I found the items here too salty.

As for dessert, the selection was pretty nice. They had gelato, various pies and beignets! It was my first time ever to see beignets at a buffet. They weren't necessarily the best beignets but they decent. The beignets that night were filled with apple filling.

This buffet also had a nice coffee machine where folks can choose various coffee drinks such as espressos, cappuccinos and hot chocolate. This machine is certainly popular because it kept running out of coffee. I had to go back three times before it was working and filled. What is nice about this is, they have to-go coffee cups if you want to take it to-go.

The Rampart Buffet is alright. It's not necessarily the best buffet in Vegas but I won't complain especially with a "buy one, get one free" coupon ;).

Imagine a buffet in a nursing home. And not a very nice nursing home. We've eaten at the Rampart buffet numerous times only because it has been comped. We aren't talking hit-or-miss bad, here. It's consistently awful. Trying to think of something that might be positive, and the best I can do is, the servers are efficient. And I had a nice hush puppy. Once.

Quality, quality, quality!! I experienced a salad bar with green lipped mussels and shrimp. Did I say this is a buffet?? What did I Drink? Just finished my third quality champagne. What the F... This place is one of Vegas Best Top Secrets. I'm so glad my partner chose this place. In my mind on Sundays ,YOU NEED TO GET YOUR MOUTH OVER TO RAMPART. Did I say that I'm full and happy. I WILL RETUrN!! WOW!! But first I'm going to see what other goodies lurk :)

First time at rampart buffet. I loved crab legs.. it wasnt salty. It was perfect with butter haha.  Cioppino was good too~  and cook name ralf was so very helpful..ihad a great dinner..ill definitly going back soon.

Great buffet.The Rampart Buffet has a wide variety of food choices for their breakfast, lunch, and dinner buffets. 

There are sometimes discount coupons in the local paper that you can use to save on the buffet. You can save money too by showing your Rampart Casino players club card to the cashier.

The lines at night can be very long, so you have to wait sometimes 45 minutes in line to get in. The line for the disabled people is always shorter. The service maybe slower there at night due to the amount of tables each server has to wait on and turn over during the busy times. It is good to be understanding. 

The Rampart Buffet is a favorite of the locals.

I love the JW Marriott but this buffet could definitely use some improvements with selection. Stayed there for a few days for work and had to eat there several times. Every time I went to the ice cream machine it was empty. My saving grace was the salad bar.

No complaints...quiet buffet, attentive service, food commensurate with price.

Look: I went twice in a row (dinner Mon, dinner Tue). On Wed, I thought I was going upscale by throwing more money down at Planet Hollywood Spice Market Buffet.

What a costly mistake. I'm coming back to Rampart. SMB was overpriced, oversalted, overstingy. See separate review.

Rampart has its place and role- quiet residential suburb, no wild, inebriated fools, convenient parking, and EXTRA convenient if you happen to be staying at the JW.

Went here Friday night as it was advertised as Passover dinner and Friday was the first night of Passover.  The cost was $23 per person because it was their usual seafood night and their idea of making it a Passover dinner was to display a few Passover items. Unfortunately there were not enough of them and what was there was AWFUL.  IT WAS A COMPLETE RIP OFF AND I WILL NEVER GO BACK THERE AGAIN AND SPEND THOS PRICES FOR A HOLIDAY DINNER.

We went to the Saturday brunch and were pleasantly surprised. The food was good - no it was above good  - even had lamb which we had never seen at a buffet in Vegas.  I had an omelet made for me and it had to be the best omelet I had ever had.  The service was excellent, and for the price it surpassed all our expectations.  This buffet I will definitely be returning to.

A very so-so buffet.  Disappointed that food looked prettty shabby.  Service was excellent; it was the food that let me down.  I saw some mussels, clams and one fish dish as far as seafood was concerned.

We are lucky enough to go to the Friday Seafood buffet at least twice a month.  The Snow crab is awesome and cooked perfectly, also never ending!  They also have some great dishes in the Asian section, calamari salad that is fresh and always yummy!  There is peel and eat shrimp on the salad bar that is wonderful too.  The Ramparts desserts are by far THE best desserts on any buffet!  They make everything from my favorite rugula to white chocolate mousse topped with fresh raspberries! 

Oh and the Sunday brunch!  All I am going to say is Eggs benedict! 

The staff is always so nice and treats us like kings!  My husband has MS so we need a table as close to the food as possible, they always accommodate!   Ann and the staff are the best!

This buffet used to have pretty good food for a reasonable price. But I haven't been here for awhile...and things have changed. Today their brunch was pretty bad. The carved meats were tough and grisily, the scrambled eggs were undercooked, the English Muffin of the Eggs Benedict was too tough to slice with a knife....and what can I say about the oatmeal. It was mostly water with some chunks of oatmeal floating in it. These deficits caused me to subtract a few stars. I will say that the Rosemary Roasted Chicken was very good--moist and flavorful. But it's not enough for me to recommend their Sunday Brunch or give them more than one star.

I visited twice during a recent stay at the JW Marriott. I found this buffet to offer a good variety and an excellent value. Gourmet? No. But at $15 to $20 per person for dinner, depending on the day of the week, it's satisfying and offers something for everyone.

The service was friendly though it was sometimes difficult to get a drink refill: I had to flag someone down.

Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if you are in the neighborhood and looking for a buffet without venturing to the casinos closer to the city, this is a decent place.

I went to this buffet on a Tuesday for lunch so I realize that maybe the offerings weren't top shelf but I wanted to review the joint anyway for those of you who may also end up dining here on a Tuesday afternoon. The good is that seniors with players club cards get in for $5 each. Regular price is $11.99 or $9.99 with a players club card - this is for m-f lunch only. The price includes drinks. 

As for the buffet itself, it consisted of a small salad bar (with tiny plates) with two soups, three areas of food and one area of desserts. There was also an automatic cappuccino station between desserts and the Italian food set up. The three types of food represented were Italian, broad-spectrum Asian, and American. For my $9.99 I got some romaine with black olives and ranch, a piece of rotisserie chicken, some green beans, and some mixed Asian veggies. The chicken was actually good and the romaine was crisp and fresh so I can't complain about the food I ate - just wish there had been more options that looked palatable to me at the time. In terms of desserts they have a ton of those, including soft serve, meringues, gingerbread cookies (likely seasonal), and a few no sugar added items like carrot cake, apple crumble pie and some kind of chocolate mousse or pudding cake. 

Our waitress was a doll and we didn't have to wait long to be led to a table. All in all it was a pleasant experience but I wouldn't go out of my way to return for the Tuesday afternoon buffet given other cheaper more fulfilling options.

Based on a recommendation we tried the weekend Buffet Champagne Brunch. Service was prompt and follow up for refreshment refills were timely. The buffet menu has a wide selection of items. Quality of the food is mixed. 
Items we tasted are:

 Kung Pao Chicken - Hot and great flavors
Spring Rolls - Warm and crisp
Grilled Fish - Warm, flaky and no bones
Roasted Chicken - Cold & dry
Eggs Benedict - Warm, perfectly cooked yolk
Garden Salad - Variety of crisp vegetables and greens
Peal & Eat Shrimp - Shells were difficult to remove
Pancakes - Cold and dry
Bacon - Warm & limp
Hash Browns - Cold & Hard
Mashed Potatoes - Hot & Creamy
Peas, Carrots & Corn - Cold
Ice Cream/Gelato - Creamy & tasty flavors

I did not see the label on the Sparkling Wine but it was too sweet for my taste

The price (age 50+ with a Resort Rewards card) is $11.99 per person. The price plus the mixed quality, warrants 2 stars. A real bargain buffet but lower quality, price and less ambiance  than Hawthorn Grill in the JW Marriott tower.

Rampart was a buffet I expected more from.

The wife and I checked it out at about 5:30PM, hoping to get in early and avoid the crowds. Unfortunately the average age of Rampart Casino guests seems to be about 70, so the place was absolutely PACKED and there were more than a few walking frames and so forth adding to the bedlam inside.

Once we eventually got seated our servers seemed harried, the food stations were absolutely hammered and needed replenishment and drink service was slow due to inadequate staffing due to the crowds.

The food was of reasonably quality, although a bit on the bland side for my liking. Clearly catering to an elderly crowd.  I enjoyed my T-Bone steak and some sort of almond gravy meatballs, but overall it wasn't an experience I'd care to repeat without a very good coupon.
I went for lunch midweek and was very happy with the selection and quality of food offered along with the tremendous service I received.  Definitely worth the price.

Went to the Wednesday night brazillian buffet @ $20pp and it looked delicious so, we had to try it out...
 I had a salad to start. Pretty good.
I then proceeded to go and get my plate for the dinner portion...
BE CAREFUL..CAUTION::..there is a 4" floor stripping that goes across connecting the busy looking carpet to the hard tile that has a 15° angle to it. It blends in with the busy carpet and if your shoes gets on it, its gonna cause a sprain to your ankle and possibly a head injury from hitting the salad bar granite counter top.
This happened to me. I had reconstructive ankle surgery back in Aug. 2014 and you guessed it..my boot hit the strip. Sprained my ankle and ended up in an ambulance to the Summerlin Medical Center and followed up with my doctor in Atlanta, Ga.
I had a party of 8. The manager was not concerned about me. They didnt even pay us back from not eating.
I ended up paying $20 for a salad.

I seen lots of "older" people in here with walkers and canes, my husbands one of them, could have broke a hip if he had hit it.

The casino has still failed to fix this or claim the fault.

I urge people to be cautious.

I will NOT be returning to this establishment.(see picture of the strip between the carpet and the tile)
Don't waste your time or money..... Small buffet with few options, low quality food, and poor service..   Go to the Suncoast or McDonalds down the street

Went for Thursday night ny deli night.   It was fun to taste all the food I grew up with.  While nothing warranted seconds as all buffets don't have highest quality food we enjoyed ourselves.  And unlimited dr Browns soda!   Well probably be band.   Waitress was very nice too :)
Terrible, terrible, nasty food. Very few selections and poor quality food. The only good part of this restaurant was that we had good service from our waiter.

I've been to this buffet many times. I have to say that the food were decently good. I've eaten here for Brunch, Lunch And Dinner during my hotel stay. 

Brunch-The foods thar they put out for brunch were decenty good. Typical for a brunch meal. The Asian section didn't serve the beef chow mein which I loved! 

Lunch-The foods that they served for lunch were decent. 

Dinner-The foods were delicious during dinner including the Seafood that they offer Friday and Saturday nights! The calamari salad was so delicious! 

Dessert-They were a great selection of desserts. From cake, ice cream, soft serve ice cream, etc. You name it! 

Service-The service was excellent! Very friend servers and Host! They did an excellent job of keeping the buffet nice and clean! 

I could've gone there for The NY Deli buffet and Taco Buffet but, I didnt have time to experience that. I might go back someday to experience it!

Went to seafood and prime rib night Friday. They didn't have any prime rib left 45 minutes before the buffet even closes. If you are going to charge people for that then you should have enough. Server was great and rest of the buffet was pretty good. Point of interest you can go to the casino next door to the south and the seafood buffet is slightly cheap.

First time here. 

Pros-
Clean
Polite staff 
Cheap 
Easy parking 

Cons-
No much choice 
Food is not quality

We have been going to the Rampart Buffet for quite a few years, and had always enjoyed it, but this last  visit will be our last. The only good thing on this visit was the dessert offerings.

It was supposed to be "Steak & Shrimp Scampi night", so we were all looking forward to dinner. When we arrived, the Shrimp Scampi was actually a pasta dish, with a few mushy, overcooked shrimp and a very bland cream sauce. The "steak" was actually Prime Rib, which looked as if it was left over from the previous night. The whole roast was a sickly grey, and there was no possibility of getting a rare or medium rare piece. 

The pork spare ribs were all fat, the cottage cheese at the salad bar was spoiled, pineapple was dried out, and when I went to get horseradish, there was a huge, black hair wrapped around the bowl of the ladle. I could go on....

Really disappointed. This used to be a nice place to get a well cooked buffet meal, but now it seems to have turned into the stereotype for a poorly maintained buffet :-(.
There isn't a big selection of food. The food wasn't fresh, everything was dry or bland tasting. The desserts were hard & super dry. Only good thing was the ice cream.
The highlight of our dinner was the beef ribs, prime rib and gelato. service was good but I couldnt reccomend this to family or friends visiting unless its comp.

Lots of mediocre and bad reviews had me hesitant to even step in line, I am glad I did. Tuesdays with a club card, anyone over the age of 50 gets a lunch buffet for $5. Short and sweet, excellent salad  bar, soup, entrees, desserts. Very well worth going back. Hands above the Suncoast, Main Street, etc. Will be frequenting quite often.

VERY DISAPPOINTED.  I was given a 2 for 1 coupon, and tried the buffet on Tuesday evening Feb, 25th.  $17 for a quite buffet seemed OK, until perusing the food on display, I was over come with "Sticker Shock".

The buffet appeared to be half full, with a few families, and but most of the senior citizens knew each other.  Our waitress was efficient, polite and did not forget us, as most buffet rooms are understaffed making it impossible for all but seasoned staff able to cope.  

The Prime beef was melt in your mouth, the Pork was not dry, and also melt in your mouth.  Marble tofu, had no pork (sad), to many vegetables, but the sauce had good consistency, instead of tofu in water debacle served in Boulder Station. The remainder of the Asian food looked like it had been setting in the trays since noon. Since I was there for dinner, I tried one, spring roll and in my opinion they need to hire a Asian food cook.

Spaghetti noodles were floating in water, and completely mush, sauce had a good flavor, but could not finish it with the overcooked spaghetti noodles.  Maybe if I had no teeth.   The milky fluid and water socked corn was passed quickly.  

Salad, venue was far better, crisp and kinda appetizing compared to the cooked food, but I was quite disappoint, I could have visited any McDonald down the street & around the corner for a better prepared meal, with two exceptions: The Beef was amazing, and one "No Added Sugar" hard Ice Cream, with a Chocolate flavor that was wonderful.  

Unless you are possessed and mad, this is a buffet to avoid, unless you live next door, and have lost your teeth along with the sense of smell, and taste.  Or you do not enjoy eating, and are very angry at the long lines and understaffed buffets of other Casinos.

We were in Summerlin on Monday so decided to finally give the buffet at the Rampart a chance for lunch. I'd read the reviews, so I was a bit hesitant. We immediately noticed that the clientele is pretty elderly, and I think that their food reflects that (we're in our mid-60s, but they were all a lot older than we are). Ribs were all they had at the carving station, and they were so overcooked that they only had about two bites of meat on them. That seemed pretty ridiculous as the meat choice. The vegetables consisted of things like overcooked peas and carrots, and lots of mushy looking food. It reminds me of my 85 year old mother, who loves her vegetables cooked to death so she doesn't have trouble with her false teeth!  They did have really good macaroni salad, and the salad bar was nice--fresh fruit, etc. They did a pretty good job with desserts, and having a coffee machine where we could get a cappuccino after the meal was very fun. The people working there were very nice and helpful. Maybe their clientele is mostly elderly locals and that's why the menu is what it is-- but I think they'd do themselves a favor by cooking fresher foods that have more appeal, especially considering the price (which is several dollars higher than Station and many other local casinos). I didn't think it was worth the price at all, and that was disappointing considering that it's a nice casino and the personnel there seems great. We would have gone back again if the food was better, but I doubt I'll ever get my husband to go there again.

5/2/2016  We ate at the Rampart Buffet on Seafood Night (Friday) and there was a long line an hour before the buffet opened.  We were finally seated and our drink order was taken immediately.  There was a long line at the Crab Legs and with as many people waiting, you'd think they would have two serving stations.  We actually ate off our plate while standing in line to get some crab legs (something I've never done before, but I was hungry). The deep fried shrimp hit the spot while waiting.  I read where the crab legs on ice had more flavor and tried them on the second helping and they were and were easier to break open.  There soon became a line at the iced crab legs.  Some of the crab was overcooked and rubbery.  I enjoyed everything anyway, as If the long lines and wait had made me hungrier.  The deserts were excellent and I sampled a variety of dishes and was impressed.  The wait staff removed our dirty dishes and kept our drinks refilled.  I enjoyed eating at the Rampart Buffet but wish there was a remedy for the wait to get in and the wait once in, to get the food.

Better than Aliante, not better than Aria.  The pizza was burned on the bottom but piled with cheese.   The mushroom soup was tasty,  nothing that was overly dry but nothing was wow flavorful either.   Descent variety but the disappointment was dessert.   It looked creative but the only thing that tasted very good was vanilla pudding and pecan ice cream.  Our server was attentive and the staff tried to keep the place clean.  Minimal smoke from the casino on a Monday night.

Went to Friday Night Seafood buffet just after 8pm a few weeks back.

Started with salad, then crab legs.

Really skinny crab legs. But somewhat flavorful.

Worst Salmon ever served at Rampart!

Big disappointment!

They used to be known for their juicy Whole baked Salmons. 

Ran out of Prime Rib by 8:30pm just before I went to get some.

I figured, I would have Prime Rib because Salmon was Saddd!

So terrible Salmon & No Prime Rib.

They also started clearing food by 9pm & never warned us what was going on.
Evidently Coffee shop was going to be renovated so they needed to prepare to open for those customers?

Should have asked for a Refund!

No more Seafood night at Rampart for us!

Worst EVER buffet meal in 20 years in Las Vegas. Soups  [vegetable, egg drop] had no flavor. Spaghetti and meatballs barely passed. Pizza was chewy, very chewy.  Prime beef was anything but prime.  Soft ice cream was TOO soft, cookies so hard that Arnold Schwarzenegger would have issues  (this from banter around the dinner table ).  I won't even get into the construction traffic issue.   As a veteran, I had better meals aboard ship and advise my fellow vets to avoid the 2 for none deals, it's not worth it.

Now, the service. .....can't complain about it. ...there barely was any and when there was, it was late and not needed by then.

We used to go to the lunch buffet often and it was always a good value for the money. The carving board always had a huge slab of perfectly prepared grilled salmon.
NOT NO MORE!
It was awful, unless of course you go to a buffet for hot-dogs, hamburgers & spaghetti. Th carving board had only greasy beef ribs that had little meat. The dessert bar has nice ice-cream but they'll give you half a scoop unless you ask for more. The rest was mostly tiny but fancy nothings. I didn't see one slice of pie and the only cake was no-sugar carrot cake. The coffee used to be great, but again, NOT NO MORE!

The food is bland and severly overcooked/underseasoned. It is probably fine for people without a sense of taste and dentures, but unless you fall into that camp, you are better off finding somewhere else for a meal.

Not to big of a buffet but their food is all quality and great tasting, I've been to most Chinese buffets in Las Vegas and all their food is done on the cheaper end which causes a lack of flavor but not so at this buffet their Chinese section rivals all those that fancy sit down Chinese food places, quality ingredients and quality flavor is the outcome, friendly staff who is more then anxious to help out, something most vegas buffets lack. This place will not disappoint, what good is having a million menu items cheaply made if you can come get select items that are quality made. Definitely recommend this place for both gaming and eating at their buffet. Their cafe is another story but hey give it all a try.

My wife and I have been to the rampart Buffet several times on Friday for seafood and crab leg night and it's always been really good for the money you spend you can't go wrong. Great selection of all kinds of food and desserts. We are locals and have been to many many buffets in Las Vegas and do not believe those other reviews here that this is the worst buffet in VEGAS because that simply is not true. Get your players card and you can get a two for one coupon for the buffet.

Went there today for Christmas with my family and it was the absolute best buffet I've ever been to. I've been here 10 years and gave up on the thought of ever getting anything worth going for at a regular buffet. What a surprise! 
Everything was great!!! Tried a little of a lot and found everything to be very tasty. Obviously, they have great management and a very happy staff - kitchen and wait. Will definitely try again.

I'm sorta embarrassed that I've eaten at this crappy buffet so many times, and  I feel like I need to explain myself. Look, the Rampart sends us free coupons every single month. Yes, completely 100% FREE buffet coupons. I'm a Vegas local and eat at buffets weekly, and who am I to turn down a free meal? 

Admittedly, this buffet is one of the worst in town. The food is just pure crap and mostly fried, breaded or overly carby stuff. Be prepared for fried shrimp, fried chicken, mashed potatoes, french fries, baked potatoes, egg rolls, more potatoes....you get my drift. If you are lucky they'll have a tray with pre-mixed peas and carrots or steamed broccoli. Obviously an afterthought but at least there are SOME veggies. Most of the food is soft, mushy, easy to chew and mildly seasoned to appease the palates of their senior citizen customer base. This place was heavenly after I had my root canal because I could eat just about everything at the buffet and not hurt my recovering tooth.

That being said, the buffet does have a decent salad bar with good dressings and a good assortment of fresh fixings (including fresh crumbled bacon). When we get a free coupon, we usually go and drink soda, eat prime rib and have the salad bar. For how cheap this place is anyway, it's a pretty decent value even if you only eat the salad bar (soda, tea, coffee, juice, milk, etc. is included in the price). You can't get a decent prime rib dinner, including a drink, salad and dessert, for less than $10 anywhere else.

The New York Deli Night (every Thursday) has much higher quality food, but it's way too expensive ($19 per person). On regular nights you can find crappy Chinese food, Italian food, American food and a dessert station. Sometimes they'll have fresh strawberries at the dessert bar which is a big plus. They also have huge New York style pickles at the salad bar and they are always good. There's not a big difference between the lunch and dinner buffets. 

The weird thing about this buffet is that 95% of the time the food is just awful but there's a rare 5% of the time when the food is really super good. It's a strange phenomenon for sure but it does happen. Sometimes the prime rib is INCREDIBLY delicious (I'd say every 2 out of 5 visits the prime rib is crazy good; they obviously know how to cook prime rib). One night they had really delicious freshly made shrimp scampi with huge shrimp. This has only happened ONE TIME, though. It's just very hit or miss. The pizza is sometimes okay and other times inedible. 

If you want to fill up on mediocre lunch room school cafeteria food and your standards aren't too high, go here. If you just want a cheap meal with a salad bar and soda, go here. If you are looking for one of Vegas' best buffets, avoid this place. 

And yeah, all the comments about the old people "regulars" is right on! This place looks like a retirement home cafeteria. I love old people and I'm not an ageist at all but watch out, they will knock you over with their walkers and canes if they think you are trying to cut in front of them in the fried shrimp line! You have been warned!

Went on a regular Thursday night and the food was blah.. Nothing was really good it was just blah. Service is great people were friendly and kind Mrs. Bing (a server) was one of the nicest people ever. Really went out of her way to provide GREAT customer service.

This was by far the best buffet I've gone to since moving to Vegas 2 months ago. Mind you, we go to the less expensive buffets. But for under $10, this buffet is top of the list. The food was very good and even though the selection was a little less than a couple others we've gone to, the food quality was much higher. Also, the service was stellar. This was the first Vegas buffet where I haven't had to flag down wait staff to beg for drink refills. And if you look be bread pudding, your gonna love dessert time here:)

food is disappointing. they had a variety of breakfast food, salads, chinese and comfort food. however, food was not delicious. fried chicken was the best and that is sad for a buffet. lamb was okay and smoked salmon. they need to get better cooks. 

service was great from the servers! 

i would not go back to eat here unless they revamp everything.

Is probably the best cheap buffet in Las Vegas ! This restaurant is very good, cheap and employees are so nice and professional. Large choices of food, quiet spaces to eat. I recommend to get the Rampart Reward card you can get discount on prices. The Champagne Brunch is really cool on Saturday and Sunday :-)

I seriously don't understand why people rate this buffet so low? Its not a snobby 50$ buffet, its an inexpensive buffet with food that actually tastes good.

We came here Friday for lunch, since we thought they offered breakfast which they don't. I had a free coupon for a buffet and with your card its only 7.99 (6.99 50+), only 1 discount per card though. Without the free players card its 9.99. Dinner is various prices because of the variety of special nights they have. Sun-Tues is 13.99 with card and 15.99 sans card. 

The lunch offerings are typical but delicious. I'm not the best person to go to a buffet because I usually eat few things, but here I actually tried a lot of different foods. My favorite was def the gyoza, it was deep fried but perfect. It wasnt oily or anything! They also had my fave chow fun. The fries here are also seasoned perfectly. The beef stew was delicious, as was the spring rolls and pizza. 

They have a great salad bar here with many fresh fruit options including pineapple! We also went to the champagne brunch on Sunday which is super cheap! 12.99 with card, 14.99 without!!! Unlimited champagne, apple crepe things, leg of lamb, prime rib, fresh fruit, and omelets! In addition to all the other brunch foods. They also have espresso machines and a great dessert area.

The best part of the buffet is the customer service! Our servers on both days were so awesome and perfect! Its hard to find a good happy server, but Rampart did! They were both enthusiastic and attentive. I'm a little bastard and ask for different drinks and both were totally nice and ok with it. 

Next I want to try the steak night, and possibly NY deli. Please dont come here and be a douche expecting Bellagio style food. Its cheap, fresh, delicious, and the servers are awesome. Dont be a hater!

Yay!!!!

Well, I went on a Wednesday which was steak night. I didn't see any actual streak, except very tiny filet mignon....which was fine because I could just load it all up on one plate...the thing that really bothered me was the meat was cooked unevenly. Parts of it were rare and well done on the same pieces. It was like picking random pieces not knowing what type you were going to get. 

The beef brisket was decent, not the best. But I would eat it again.

As always with any buffet calamari I have tried, it's the equivalent of eating a tire. 

Salmon is salmon, it's the same at every place I've been to. Nothing special. 

Carrot cake was good, though.

Took my Mother to Rampart Buffet for Christmas Brunch. However, the food was not very good as compared to the evenings that we have went to the buffet. Staff is always good. However, you go for the food and the quality was sub par at best.

Thursday night is NY Deli theme night at this buffet, and since we were entertaining some NY friends who descend into withdrawal if they go without deli for too long, they jumped at the chance.  We warned them that the Las Vegas concept of deli is like the Statue of Liberty at New York/New York - all smoke and mirrors and totally fake, but they were brave and hungry.

We got there at about 8:30 pm, early enough for all the food still to be available, but too late for it not to be dried out.

The Pluses: 
-  the homemade potato knish is fabulous, and full of caramelized onions.  And they have deli mustard to accompany it, though at a different counter.

-  the Douwe Egberts coffee machine spits out dark roast coffee, latte, cappuccino, and a few other choices.

-  the cheesecake is fairly good, but wouldn't give Cheesecake Factory any competition.

The Minuses:
-  the corned beef was dry, rubbery, and tasteless

-  the mussels tasted weird, in a spit-it-out kind of way

-  the shrimp, described as "walnut shrimp" on the card, had no walnuts, but were sickeningly sweet

-  the pastrami tray, which was half-full, consisted of the tiny bits that fall off the pastrami when you cut it.  There wasn't a single bit that could be called a SLICE.  If I were hankering for a pastrami sandwich, I would have been wearing it instead of eating it.

The other foods that were part of the NY Deli "experience," such as the potato pancakes, gefilte fish, herring in cream sauce, matzo ball soup, and the like, are all things that I wouldn't touch with a ten-foot pole.  But the others pronounced them "okay," but not great.  

Some good things, like the sliced smoked salmon and the brisket, which Red Rock offers at their special holiday buffets, were nowhere to be seen here.

We had a restaurant.com certificate, so the price was reasonable.  Without it, you can eat much better - and fresher - at Red Rock, and for less money.

This review is based only on their New York Deli buffet on Thursdays. This is now the only day I like to go to their buffet. If you like Dr. Browns soda they have all you can drink. They have them in Root Beer, Black Cherry, and even Celery. Yes I did say Celery I kept thinking the waitress was saying cherry. I didn't try that flavor though. 

I enjoy making sandwiches from their deli select meats especially when we get the bread toasted. It tastes better than any Subway sandwich! I also like their beef stew because you don't need a knife to cut it. I typically eat it with their mashed potatoes and potato knishes. YUM! I also get a side of their walnut shrimp that has melon balls in it.

I don't like to leave without having their cheese cake. I'm not a fan of cheese cake in general but I like it here because it's nice and soft. It is tasty even though it is plain. If you are planning on going to a buffet on a Thursday night you should give this one a try!
The prime rib was over cooked.  The pork loin was dry.  Not a large selection of desserts.  They got rid of the black velvet chocolate cake.
I had been a couple of times in the past, but today's visit was horrible.. I won't be returning.  Food wasn't that good.  Comparable to a mediocre buffet like Railroad Pass..

Literally wanted just crab legs today and wanted to stay on the west side of town. I've never been to "Rampart Casino" - didn't even know it existed! 

"Rampart Buffet" - the area was so CLEAN, I was quite surprised. Usually, a majority of even the nicer buffets are spoiled with food that extends outside of the platter...but not at this place! 

Friday is CRAB LEGS & SEAFOOD NIGHT (4pm - 9pm) and if you have a players card it'll cost you about $50 for two people. I started with the cold crab legs since there was no line, and those were slightly too salty - no butter necessary. 

I had two rounds of the steamed crab legs and that was enough for me to be done. The legs are not baby sized either, contrary to what some other reviewers have stated. The legs were larger sized and offered plenty of crab meat! They offer a wide variety of other seafood items (fried shrimp, cod, salmon, cocktail shrimp, seafood soup, mussels, etc)...but I can't comment on that b/c I just came for the crab legs and apparently the dessert. 

There were countless dessert items that made my mouth water and they all looked scrumptious. I didn't try everything but from what I did eat, the strawberry cheesecake was THE BEST. The apple tart came second with the lemon tart being third, imo. 

Lastly, I love that this place has a coffee / expresso machine that also serves hot chocolate! It is extremely popular too. The coffee with milk (no sugar added) goes very well with some of the dessert items! 

If I'm ever craving crab legs like I was today, I'll definitely give this place a second look.
Need to get here early or later 8pm The Crab legs are good here and so is the food depending if you like waiting I don't!

A cheap buffet with middle of the road standard selections.  I did use this buffet to feed my wedding guests and they all enjoyed themselves including my niece who only ate chipotle.  If you want a buffet with old school pricing this is a decent place to eat

I was surprised that there was no line and on entering there were very few diners. It soon became apparent why; there were only a few dishes offering anything close to eye appeal.  I don't mind sacrificing a little quality for variety, but this buffet included canned corn and peas/carrots.  I stopped whining long enough to eat a salad with bottled blue cheese dressing, overdone mahi mahi, one bite out of a dried out BBQ pork rib,2 slices of overdone pork loin, a chocolate covered strawberry and a tasteless Napoleon.

It wasn't horrible, I just don't go back. The food is pretty blaise. Is this like a healthy buffet devoid of salt? If you are enemies with salt, your home is called Rampart buffet. The selection is not big but it's adequate and decent. The salad bar is nice and the staff very good.

We were here a week ago to see some friends and do a little gambling. Yes, going to a buffet in Las Vegas can indeed be a gamble,  especially when seafood is part of the equation! Happy to report my husband (seafood lover) and the rest of us came out winners!! :)

Dinner was $22.99 a piece without a rewards card and only $18.99 with one. I did have a mailer coupon which was a Bogo deal. A pretty good savings. Stop by the rewards center and sign up for Free!  I definitely recommend getting on the mailer list through the slot club reward center. Even if you do not like to gamble, the coupons come in the mail with the "hopes" that you will!

 The Steak & Seafood Buffet is available on Saturday in addition to pizza and some Asian selections. Seafood portion had a pretty good selection of king crab legs. The petite filets were good too. Salad was fresh and the displays were  kept clean. Food was good, not great.

Service was quick and friendly. The manager was interacting with guests and she appeared to have a genuine care for the customers and the overall appearance of the buffet, making sure employees were doing what needed to be done to keep things running smoothly.

Yeah, I would recommend Rampart Buffet as one of your safer bets while in Las Vegas. Enjoy! :)

Buffet? Well just because I live in Las Vegas doesn't mean I like to gamble with my food! We went to the Rampart Buffet around 11AM. It was about $16 each to enter and I was wildly disappointed with the food. The shrimp laid out next to the sandwich  mayonnaise totally grossed me out, the ham at the breakfast bar was brown, english muffin ...well I don't know how old it was but my fiance's butter knife wouldn't cut thru it. 

I played it safe and had a salad ( tasty! ) and some strawberries. 

I wish I could have done a walk thru before I paid to eat there. Barf.

This place is far off from the strip, it's attached to the JW Marriot Resort.  It was probably a 15 minute drive from the strip but given that we had a 2 for 1 coupon from the ACG, we decided to come out and give it a try.  It is usually $9 dollars a person for lunch but since we had a coupon, it came to $10 dollars with tax for both of us.  The selection of food was actually quite good for the price.  In fact the Chinese station had a decent selection of good Chinese food, which included real Chinese long beans instead of string beans and stir fried clams in black beans sauce.  

The only bummer side of our meal was that we lost quite a bit of money here.  However if you go, be prepared because it's like a assisted living facility with all the seniors.  In fact most of the employees that work here know the customers on a first name basis and when they get their next social security check..
Try their seafood buffet in Friday night, has snow crab legs, roast beef , smoked salmon, all are ok...service on par,  price is fair compare to the strip casino buffet.

We spent Thanksgiving in Vegas and had the pleasure of staying at the JW Marriott. Since there are about 7 restaurants at the hotel, we spent some time deciphering where to eat. Majority of the restaurants were offering Thanksgiving dinner for about $50 per person. After viewing the Rampart Buffet menu, and the fact that the Thanksgiving meal was only $19.00, we decided to give it try, keeping in mind that if we did not like it, were were only out 40 bucks and could go eat somewhere else. 

To our surprise, the food was very good and the service was excellent. They had every type of meat you could think of for Thanksgiving -  turkey, ham, leg of lamb, prime rib, you name it. The sides were really good, particularly the sweet potato casserole, mac and cheese, and roasted vegetables. They also had a variety of desserts. The sweet potato pie was not bad. The customer service was very good as well. The waitstaff was friendly and attentive.

This review is not just for the great food particularly on Thursday Deli Night, but also for the outstanding customer service from Ann, the manager who was very hospitable and professional! We came around 8PM and noticed the matzoh ball soup was low on matzoh balls. We come especially for this soup...it's that good!  When this was brought to Ann's attention she said she would take care of it and did. Right away, they brought out more of that heavenly soup. Mazel Tov to the great chef too!  We also love that they're the only buffet we know of with a cappuccino machine!

I came on 3/18. The same day their system was updating, they were offering $10 dinner buffet for the inconvenience. I came with a bogo buy 1 get 1 coupon and paid $10.81 for 2 people. 

The selections was very standard, asian, pizza, pasta, salad/deli bar, and carving station. Not a big selection for food. However, I gave it an extra star for their coffee machine. Instead of ordering it with the waitress, there was a large section where you can customized your own coffee, espresso,etc (yes, there is an espresso machine)

The dessert offered more, self serve ice cream, or their "gourmet ice cream" section, more toppings for ice cream. There was creme brule, panna cotta (which was bland), cake, cookie, and lemon tart (very tarty).

Overall, for the price I paid, I am satisfied. 

I do recommend coming here if you are around the area.

Horrible buffet food. The prime rib Meat is so so so dry.  I also tried the roast pork, so dry.  Chinese food:  roast pork- dry, pork bun- little filling and not good, shrimp hargao- mushy siaomai- mushy, breakfast items: bacon- decent, sausage- decent, corned beef hash- filled with potatoes.  Anyways you can see the trend.  All the food items here arent cooked very well.  The taste and quality is to be desired.  On the bright side, this place is clean, nice environment and offers a goos selection of food.  Good ice cream selextion.  Thats about it.  I wouldnt come back

Yikes, went for Brazilian BBQ night (despite the yelp reviews) 
This is equivalent to Terribles Buffet back in the day but at 4x the price.
$21.99 (but we had a buy one get one that came in the mail). 


The Highs:
-It's close to my house without having to deal with a "real" buffet on the strip w traffic, etc...which is why I think it gets customers in the door at THAT price and with THAT food.
-The tandoori chicken was decent and somewhat authentic

The lows:
-Very cheap meat (brisket and some other hunk of beast next to it)
-No steak...not even a sirloin cut? $21.99 and it's Brazilian night...throw something out there
-Egg drop soup was watery
-Chicken noodle soup was too salty
-Limited ingredients to make a garden salad...tomatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, cheese and dressing...no croutons, no onions, no carrots, no broccoli
-Limited options and since nothing was excellent, I didn't leave stuffed

If you come here for dinner without any kind of deal in your pocket, run!

We went to the Rampart Casino to check out the casino.  When we signed up for the Players Club, we received a buy one/get one coupon for the buffet.  Went to the buffet not expecting anything because I'd never heard about it, good or bad.  We went on steak night.  Very good steak selection!  The steak was cooked perfectly and of good quality.  The salad bar had a nice selection as did the dessert bar.  The Asain and Italian stations had about 7-8 items to choose from each and everything I tried was very good.  I normally do not like the pastas at buffets but I went back for seconds here.  The buffet didn't have as many choices as some buffets around town but what they did have was very, very good.  We will definitely go back - and it's on the opposite side of town for us but it's that good.

The food is not great. service very good. If you are looking for a good buffet you would do better at Golden Corral than here and
You pay less.
Got food poisoning here yesterday--it was either from the lettuce or the shrimp dumpling

Had a free buffet coupon so only had to pay for one person. Not a huge fan of buffets as everything is usually pretty mediocre but I couldn't find one thing that was even mediocre here. I had to remind my husband that we were traveling the following morning and not eat things he thought initially tasted a bit off. Even the salad bar seemed dirty and sparse. Would not go back even if it were free for both of us.

Myself and 2 friends ate at this Buffet on Thursday night.  What a big mistake.  this place was terrible.  The price would have been OK had the food and service been up to par.  The short ribs were so so, the Asian selections were terrible and the Sandwich line items looked old and dry.  I tried the Prime Rib and by the time I made it back to my table it was completly dried out and the taste reminded me  of Dried Beef Steak from VietNam.  The Salad bar was just OK but not a lot of selection.  My friends also were not too impressed with their buffet choices.  We decided to try the deserts.  Creme Brulee had a taste never experienced before and the Soft Ice Cream/Yogurt(?) was like a frozen Chocolate Ice.  The Fresh Strawberrys were excellent however .  Needless to say I will not return to this buffet and would not recommend it to others expecting a good Las Vegas Buffet.

Don't eat the mussels next to the cold crab legs.  I got food poisoning.  The hot crab legs on Fridays are hit or miss.  Sometimes they're really meaty and juicy and other times they're small and not tasteful.

The staff were really nice. The food though, was all luke warm. The ribs looked like they had already been cooked, sat out all day, then put back out when more needed to be replenished. The deserts where good though and looked fresh. However everything else was sub par.  *If you stay at the JW Marriott they provide a $5 discount.

Went for sunday brunch because i was sent a 2 for 1 voucher and thank goodness we had the voucher because they are very pricey. I understand that seafood is pricey but i dont eat it so maybe they should offer different prices. I was also never offered the champayne and barely got offered the diet soda that i was drinking. I enjoyed the food that i ate but it was no different than any of thr hundreds of buffets in the area.

Years ago when they had the buffet upstairs overlooking the city it was litterally a 5 star buffet, Excellent food like the Mirage buffet. But I knew it was going to suffer when it changed hands and they moved it to the dank hall way its in now. I stopped going about 5 years ago until last week I went on friday night and the highlight of my meal was some lousy frozen yogurt I grabbed on my way out the door. I hope they reach bottom soon and can pull their heads out. You can tell were the JW Marriott ends and the Rampart takes over the casino.

This is the first time that I have ever given a restaurant a 1 star and a 1 star is absolutely to high for this buffet!  JW Marriott should be ashamed of themselves to even have such a buffet open!  But, we should have known when the players card representative told us, "Oh yeah, y'all came on a good day to try the buffet!"

Rampart Buffet is one if not the top three worst buffets in Las Vegas.  It was so bad, I don't even know where to begin.  Well, we went for brunch on a Sunday and we paid $14.99. The buffet is VERY SMALL!!!  So, let' begin: the waffles were hard and lacked flavor, the pancakes could have been used as table coasters, the bacon and sausage had so much grease, you could have poured it into your gas tank and drove back home.  The salad bar...what salad bar!  I saw a bar with lettuce, and dressing (cheap dressing at that), and it was over.  Next we tried the hot food station, which contained Prime Rib, Turkey, Mashed Potatoes, Mixed Vegetables, and corn.  But oh lord, I would have rather eaten the food from a nursing home or Shady Pines than eat this food.  Who even ate mashed potatoes that had to be scooped up with an ice cream scooper and then it just ran onto your plate??  I had to use the corn to make it thick again!    

Now the servers were kind, and they worked very hard.  But I would suggest them finding another job, because this place is about to close or it should.  Overall, I would recommend going to Silver 7 Casino before coming here.

Went for the weekend Champagne Brunch and was pleasantly surprised. Although they don't have the selection that GVR or Red Rock has, the quality of the food is definitely better. Where I would find sitting dried Eggs Benedict elsewhere, they were always fresh here. The champagne or mimosas are also a nice benefit.  Service was a little frenzied, but kind of expected during peak hours. Good and (again) fresh selection of desserts. Overall, a very good value!

This buffet was really good 
Great selection 
Great service 
Really tasty prime rib
Coffee bar
Salads selection was abundant 
Macaroons fiend with
We will be back !!!!

Excellent Saturday morning buffet.  Everything from Chinese food to breakfast.  Lots of champagne too.  Perfect service.  Tasty desserts including gelato.  Muscles were great, prime rib rare and lean.  Turkey a bit salty.  Fried chicken light not greasy.  Oh the mashed potatoes creamy.  We were a party of three, got there the moment they opened.  At 5:30 I am still stuffed!

Exhausted from a day of travel, we thought it would be easier to just eat in the hotel (JW Marriott). Unfortunately for us, this buffet has an early bird special plus a deal for seniors, and the line was very long at 5:30 PM.  We waited almost 30 minutes to get in, and then they have you pay BEFORE you sit down. Everyone had coupons, restaurant.com papers, deals and more deals.   The cashier was so slow, we became cranky and annoyed before we were seated.

That said, I liked the mussels marinara, the bok choi veggies and the prime rib. The salads were weak, no greens to speak of -- I don't eat refined carbs or desserts, so for me, the protein and veggie spread was below average. The Rampart needs to add some field greens and more green vegetables to their offerings, e.g. green beans, snap peas, brusell sprouts, sauteed collards etc.

My husband enjoyed the buffet's meat entrees and had dessert, too.  He complained the ice cream was sandy and of inferior quality.  

In sum, consider this a mediocre meal, at best.

Nothing special about this buffet- I've been to worse.  Still, it's overpriced for what it serves (like a lot of buffets here) and I probably wouldn't come here again unless invited by a friend with a free coupon. The way I came here the first time.
I don't even know why I decided on this place knowing how the Promenade Cafe is. This is probably one of the crappist buffets that you can go to in this area. Really just find somewhere else to eat.

The food was good. There was many different cuisines to try, such as Asian food, Italian food, Seafood, and a meat + salad bar. The service is also great. The deserts were wonderful. I would come again!
Learn how to steam the crab legs , either you guys burn them or you guys leave them in water for so long and they turn like plastic rubber not a way to serve your guests

Good local Buffet.  At times the quality may vary.  However, the service has been great.  We sit in the same area twice a week and Mary Lozowsk takes care of us.  She is fabulous and is one of the main reasons we go to this restaurant.

Decent buffet for $16-20 they charge, even better with the promotion the casino gave us (two vouchers for buy one get one free). The prime rib is good, mashed potatoes are from a box, other stuff is hit or miss, with some surprisingly good. Desserts weren't my favorite, nevertheless we ended up eating too much. Compared to other more expensive buffets, this was a bargain considering it had acceptable food quality for several items. We'd go back again.
